servinfo.title: Fail-Safe Table

attention3.ptxt: For identification of each cylinder, refer to Precautions for Identification of Cylinder:J24B .

servinfo.ptxt: When any of the following DTCs is detected, ECM enters fail-safe mode as long as malfunction continues to exist but that mode is canceled when ECM detects normal condition.

entry.ptxt: Camshaft Position-Timing Over-Advanced or System Performance

item.ptxt: ECM controls OCV at engine brake.
ECM controls OCV at engine idle speed.

entry.ptxt: HO2S Heater Control Circuit Low (Bank-1 Sensor-1)
HO2S Heater Control Circuit High (Bank-1 Sensor-1)
HO2S Heater Control Circuit Low (Bank-1 Sensor-2)
HO2S Heater Control Circuit High (Bank-1 Sensor-2)
Mass or Volume Air Flow Circuit Range / Performance
Mass or Volume Air Flow Circuit Low input

item.ptxt: ECM calculates intake air volume according to throttle valve position and engine speed.
ECM stops A/F control.
ECM stops EVAP canister purge valve control.

entry.ptxt: Mass or Volume Air Flow Circuit High input

item.ptxt: ECM calculates intake air volume according to throttle valve position and engine speed.
ECM stops A/F control.
ECM stops EVAP canister purge valve control.

entry.ptxt: Intake Air Temperature Sensor 1 Circuit Range / Performance
Intake Air Temperature Sensor 1 Circuit Low

item.ptxt: ECM controls actuators assuming that intake air temperature is 20 °C (68 °F).
ECM stops A/F feedback (closed-loop) control.
ECM stops IAC feedback control.

entry.ptxt: Intake Air Temperature Sensor 1 Circuit High

item.ptxt: ECM controls actuators assuming that intake air temperature is 20 °C (68 °F).

entry.ptxt: Engine Coolant Temperature Circuit Range / Performance
Engine Coolant Temperature Sensor Circuit Low

item.ptxt: ECM controls actuators assuming that engine coolant temperature is 80 °C (176 °F).
ECM operates radiator cooling fan. (high speed)
ECM stops A/F feedback (closed-loop) control.

ECM stops A/C control.

entry.ptxt: Throttle / Pedal Position Sensor / Switch “A” (Main) Circuit Low

item.ptxt: ECM turns off throttle actuator control relay and throttle valve is fixed at the opening of about 7° from its completely closed position (default opening).
ECM controls fuel cut at specified engine speed.
ECM stops A/F feedback (closed-loop) control.
